intro: Hydrotriche hottoniiflora var. flava, commonly known as the yellow flaxleaf hydatodes, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its botanical classification places it within the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots. It is characterized by its unique ability to store water in its leaves, aiding in its survival in dry conditions.
